reviews.review_msg: Professor Prest seems really passionate about what he teaches, which makes lectures more interesting. He connects course content to world events and makes class engaging. Course content can be a bit general or boring at times, but it's a 100 level course so that's expected. Overall, he's a really good prof and I enjoyed taking this class with him!

Dr. Prest's grading is very arbitrary and unfair. The rubric is very vague about what the assignment wants and the TA reduces marks very randomly with little explanation. For the exams you have 24 hours ( more like 12) to write an essay and the grading criteria for them is unfair considering the time that we have and how this is a first year course

he is such a boring prof and marks so hard. the highest grade on most of the assignments was 17/20. You have to do all the readings and even then u have to follow the criteria very specifically. Such a hard and boring class because of the way he talks.

I had Dr. Prest for POL100 a couple semesters ago. He's a fantastic lecturer and is very passionate. However, POL100 is NOT a GPA booster like many would care to think - keep up on the subject matter, ask questions/critique/areas for improvement and you WILL do well. But don't expect it to be a walk in the park.

Dr. Prest was is a great prof. Exams were 48-hour take-home exams and the research paper was easy! I recommend taking this class and participating in tutorials to boost GPA. His lectures were not to long and they were not boring.

Good prof. Class is not too hard. Weekly assignments every week but it is just a completion mark, so no stress. Final exam is a take-home exam (24 hr exam and it is 2 mini-essays). Research essay is a bit hard if you can't think of a topic. Class is manageable and readings are around 30 pages. TA marked super harshly though. Interesting class.

This class is very difficult for an intro class. The midterm and final consisted of take-home prompts, which often included very detailed and difficult concepts to comprehend and put together into a paper. Do not take this class if you are not willing to put in the effort by reading the weekly readings, attending tutorials and office hours.

Mr.Prest was honestly such an amazing professor he was easily accessible and would respond to emails quickly. His lectures do tend to get a little boring but overall from a student who didn't know much about politics, Mr.Prest makes it so much more easier to understand concepts. You can get a good mark if you put in the time.

Dr. Prest is an ok prof. If you are not interested in politics, then do NOT take this class. Lectures were very boring bc prof talked for the whole 1hr 50 min. Readings + tutorials are boring as well. 2 papers + 2 exams (that were also papers), so 4 papers in total. Weekly written assignments. Not an overwhelming course, but very boring.

He was truly ahead of his time. Take any classes you can with him. You will have to work for your grade but its doable if you attend lectures and keep up with deadlines. I didn't feel overwhelmed at all and that usually happens with pol-sci courses given that they're so intensive. My TA was awesome as well, overall a very positive experience.

Stewart is evidently over-qualified to teach a course like 200W. He uses somewhat discipline-specific language in lectures that may be unfamiliar. He did keep the class engaged through participation. Overall great prof though. Office hours helped. Gave many extensions. Assignments were mostly straightforward. Would be better in higher-level courses

I finished the class with an A. Very easy class. Just make sure to do well on the group project and to keep up with the readings and lectures. Prest is fair and approachable. I got sick and needed an extension and he was kind and gave me one on one of our papers. One of my fav poli sci profs, as he genuinely cares about his students!
- Good prof - Talks too fast - Posts lecture powerpoints - Good at being helpful at office hours - Mandatory reading might not be worth it - Lots of extensions

Easy class. Two papers and a take-home midterm and final. If you attend either the lecture or do the reading, youll be fine. Dont expect to do papers in a day. You need to make sure your writing communicates your reasoning clearly, otherwise youll lose a decent chunk of your grade. Prest can be robotic at times, but is otherwise a nice guy.
He is a kind professor who cares about his students and he is a fair marker. Put in the work and you will get a good grade!

Stewart's a bit disorganized and sometimes forgets to post lecture slides. He took a long time to give grades back but gave extensions on assignments for the whole class because of the delay and other factors. The course isn't too hard but it was quite boring online. Textbook isn't needed- his slides are very detailed and based on the book.

Prest has been one of my favourite profs in political science so far. He is very understanding and very accessible. Nothing he gives as an assignment is unfair or unreasonable, just listen to lectures and do whatever is required and you'll get an A

Prof Prest was a very nice and knowledgable prof. At times I found the class unorganized. Someone with no political science background may find the material overwhelming as there was a range of topics and themes.

great instructor unfortunatley I was unable to submit a class evaluation and so i am opting to do so here in fact this is why i made an account here. he is super knowledgable and engaging material he teaches both well versed and not well versed subjects
I think that Dr. Prest is a good prof who always helps students when they have questions. I would say that his on-campus class is more interesting than the online class but it works.

My favourite prof! Very interesting and engaging lectures - it feels like listening to NPR. Gives paragraphs of feedback with each paper or proposal. Frequent participation questions are a decent part of grade and mostly graded on proposals and final paper. Not an easy mark but a fair one. Very accommodating and flexible as well.

Stewart is an amazing prof! I have taken a couple of classes with him, and his lectures are very informative. For each assignment he gives clear instructions on what he was looking for and the feedback for each assignment outlined what needed to be fixed. Not an easy marker but definitely a fair marker. Highly recommend taking a class with him!

He is nice from what I can tell, and I think he tried really hard to adapt to the online environment but I don't think it's working for him. From awkward pauses to peculiar comments on assignments, Dr. Prest may suite some people better than others. He has high expectation for assignments, but doesn't give clear feedback.

If you ever have the opportunity to take a class with Stewart I recommend you don't! Perhaps he was just terrible because of the online environment this semester. But I probably wouldn't go with that assumption. He is very difficult marker and he cannot release or mark grades in a respectable time, plus he'll take forever to respond to an email. :
Pol 151 was a very easy class. Especially with Stewart. Good lecturer, fair grader overall good choice.

Out of all my time in university I can say Stewart was by far the best professor I've ever had. He is super fair when it comes to marking and helps you throughout the course by opening your mind to any alternatives you may not have thought about in the world of politics. When we transitioned to online classes, Stewart was cooperative/respectful.
Stewart was very accommodating while transitioning to online classes this semester. Out of all the profs I had, his online course structure was the best.

Dr. Prest is nice to his students but as a professor he is sub-par. He asks open ended questions to the class frequently and will stand awkwardly for as long as it takes for someone to respond - only to reply with an "mhm." His feedback is useful but he is the slowest marker I've ever experienced. He teaches POL347 like it was a 100 level course.

Even though I had no prior interest in CFP, I really enjoyed this course. Stewart was able to create a positive learning environment by facilitating respectful discussions, conveying complex material in a manner that is accessible + by being responsive to suggestions. Ive only taken 1 course with him, but hes my fav prof in the dept. so far!

When you see a 5.0 rating, it's tempting to think that the prof just reviewed themselves a bunch of times... Stewart is actually this good of a prof. He's the most solid combination of character, care and competence a prof can be. He's SO clear, uses recent examples, uploads the most helpful slides (including midterm/final reviews); top shelf prof!

Amazing Prof. Took him for US Politics and learned so much in a fun way. We watched lots of videos and only did a few short papers but he gave amazing feedback and always made himself accessible to all students. He always looks for the good in his students and their work. would definitely take him again
The class was fun and engaging; It really helped understand the concepts in the course.
Loved the course and fair marker. Everyone should take him, you will not be disappointed.
Best guy ever; young also.
Stewart prest is really nice and very fair with the marks. He loves his students. Just a friendly nice man.
The best professor in the department!!
